reviews.text: Ordered more than I could eat because so many things looked good. It also tastes great when it arrived. The beer was also very nice.

Excellent venue.
Our server was great and just the right level of attentive. When she wasn’t busy she told us a bit about the place and city which was very interesting and helpful.
Food was delicious and the kolsh was served in the traditional way.
Good experience for tourists and seemed popular with locals too.
It is huge so probably gets crazy busy at peak times.

I ordered the sauerbraten. the potato dumpling were good but the meat was dry, regardless of the sauce. the plate came out very fast so it makes me think that it had been prepared ahead of time and wasn’t super fresh. the service was amazing. the guy was very welcoming and checked on me often to make sure i had everything i needed.
would come here again to try a different plate.

I was tempted by reviews of good food but rude service. I really wanted to witness what rude service was in Koln. Excitement. Upon entering, the staff seemed aloof… ok… is that introduction to what rudeness is? But OMG… things just went the opposite! We had the sweetest server Sebastian Krause ⭐️. He was very patient, super efficient in topping up our beers and letting his colleagues know that we were not done with our pork knuckles - which were tasty. Fried poratoes were coated with bacon bits which made it yummier. I guess politeness will get you politeness! Thank you Sebastian!

SO.MUCH.FOOD. Definitely come here with an empty stomach because not only is the food very tasty, but the sizes of the plates are pretty big. We ordered the pork knuckle and there was no way we could finish it fully. Delicious tho! Absolutely coming back here
